description.content:
Officer Watson is walking his beat on a crowded downtown street when a middle-aged, techy-looking guy approaches him in a highly agitated state.

In this activity, you'll watch how he handles the interaction and rate his performance for each exchange.

ok.label: Did not effectively defuse the situation
ok.feedback: Actually, the officer maintained a calm demeanor and did not reflect or amplify the subject's emotional intensity. This is the very definition of "defusing."

ok.label: Did not effectively use interjection
ok.feedback: Actually, the officer did successfully manage to interrupt the subject and redirect him towards a goal.

ok.label: Did not use deflection effectively
ok.feedback: Although this may be true, deflection is actually a tactic of disengaging with an actively hostile subject. It's not relevant here since the subject is mainly just distressed and impatient.

ok.label: Tone was detatched and cold
ok.feedback: Possibly. Everyone's style will be a little different. However, when the main goal is to calm an agitated subject, maintaining a level of professional distance can often serve that purpose.

ok.label: Failed to listen effectively
ok.feedback: At this point, there's not much useful to listen to. First,the officer has to get the subject to calm down before he can get the information he needs.

good.label: Effectively defused the situation
good.feedback: The officer maintained a calm demeanor and did not reflect or amplify the subject's emotional intensity. This is the very definition of "defusing."

good.label: Effectively used interjection
good.feedback: Yes. The officer did successfully manage to interrupt the subject and redirect him towards a goal.

good.label: Used deflection effectively
good.feedback: Deflection is actually a tactic of disengaging with an actively hostile subject. It's not relevant her since the subject is mainly just distressed and impatient.

bad.label: Did not effectively defuse the situation
bad.feedback: Actually, the officer maintained a calm demeanor and did not reflect or amplify the subject's emotional intensity. This is the very definition of "defusing."

bad.label: Did not effectively use interjection
bad.feedback: Actually, the officer did successfully manage to interrupt the subject and redirect him towards a goal.

bad.label: Did not use deflection effectively
bad.feedback: Although this may be true, deflection is actually a tactic of disengaging with an actively hostile subject. It's not relevant here since the subject is mainly just distressed and impatient.

bad.label: Tone was detatched and cold
bad.feedback: Possibly. Everyone's style will be a little different. However, when the main goal is to calm an agitated subject, maintaining a level of professional distance can often serve that purpose.

bad.label: Failed to listen effectively
bad.feedback: At this point, there's not much useful to listen to. First,the officer has to get the subject to calm down before he can get the information he needs.

title.classNames: w-auto text-black text-left italic pb-4 font-bold mb-4 border-b-4 border-black border-solid text-title

description.content:
This is a set of techniques designed to re-focus your mental and emotional energy on something calming and positive.

Click on each skill to learn more.

skills.caption: tactical breathing
skills.classNames: checkbox flex items-center justify-end tactical italic uppercase bg-black w-full text-white py-3 mb-6 pr-12

skills.caption: deliberate repetition
skills.classNames: checkbox flex items-center justify-end deliberate italic uppercase bg-black w-full text-white py-3 mb-6 pr-12

skills.caption: mental imaging
skills.classNames: checkbox flex items-center justify-end mental italic uppercase bg-black w-full text-white py-3 mb-6 pr-12

skillPanels.classNames: hidden absolute top-12 right-0 tactical-panel p-6

title.classNames: uppercase w-auto text-white text-left italic pb-4 font-bold mb-4 border-b-4 border-white border-solid text-title

description.content: Breathe in slowly while counting to four in your mind. Exhale on the same count of four. Focus on your breath and nothing else.

skillPanels.classNames: hidden absolute top-12 right-0 deliberate-panel p-6

title.classNames: uppercase w-auto text-white text-left italic pb-4 font-bold mb-4 border-b-4 border-white border-solid text-title

description.content: Come up with a simple phrase that reminds you of a core strenth or a personal value, like "I am a hero to my child." Repeat this phrase to yourself slowly and deliberately, until it is the only thought in your head.

skillPanels.classNames: hidden absolute top-12 right-0 mental-panel p-6

title.classNames: uppercase w-auto text-white text-left italic pb-4 font-bold mb-4 border-b-4 border-white border-solid text-title

description.content: Conjure an image of a key moment in your past, like your swearing-in ceremony or a moment when someone expressed their gratitude to you. Try to recall every detail of this memory, both emotional and physical.

title.content: Drag and drop the description below to the matching Tenet.

choices.label: Be respectful in your words, tone, and demeanor
Treat people equally and without bias
Do what is best for people and follow through on your commitments

title.content: Drag and drop the scenario image below to the matching Tenet.

choices.text: A Latino officer stops a white male for a minor traffic violation. The man has a "Build a Wall - Send them Home" bumper sticker on his car. The man is cooperative but a bit rude. The officer refers to him as "Sir" throughtout and lets him proceed with a warning.

Officers dealing with an agitated man who accidentally trespassed and is terrified of being arrested and doesn't want to come out. Officer reassures him that he just needs to answer the questions and follows through.
Officers pulls over a trans-gender person whose DL picture, name and listed gender don't match. He pulls them aside to talk to them privately out of earshot of others in the car.
During a field contact, a subject is trying to explain why he ran when the officer asked him to stop. The officer listens carefully.

elements.classNames: opacity-100 absolute md:left-4 lg:left-20 md:-bottom-32 lg:-bottom-52 md:w-7/12 lg:w-1/2
opacity-100 absolute left-1/2 md:top-1/3 lg:top-44 w-5/12 lg:h-1/2 md:h-2/5

data.title: Evalutate how the officer did for each tenet by dragging the sliders

instruction.content: What could the officer do to give her more of a voice?

items.text: Speak to her in a quiet and calm done of voice.
items.feedback: While your tone does matter, remember, "voice" is about giving the SUBJECT a voice - by respectfully listening to her.

items.text: Listen to her explanation about the face covering. Ask her if there is a way she would feel comfortable showing her face.
items.feedback: Yes. Give the person an opportunity to explain and ask questions, rather than just dismiss her concerns.

items.text: Give her more of an opportunity to justify why she was speeding.
items.feedback: She already explained that she didn't notice the posted signs. There was another, more important way the officer could have given her a voice.

instruction.content: What could the officer do to show her more respect?

items.text: Advocate for her to be proud of who she is and to reveal her face.
items.feedback: Definitely not. "voice" not about giving someone a compliment, especially when you're asking her to ignore her religious beliefs.

items.text: Acknowledge her discomfort and suggest an alternate way she could verify her identity
items.feedback: Good. Even just acknowledging that this was an uncomfortable request would have shown that the officer was being respectful of her religious customs.

items.text: To avoid offending her, don't worry about the ID verification in this case.
items.feedback: Showing respect is not about ignoring a legal requirement to avoid offending her. What else might you do?

feedback.title: Voice
feedback.text: When I tried to explain my reasons for not removing my veil, he was dismissive. He didn't take the time to listen to me.

feedback.title: Neutrality
feedback.text: Maybe he treats everyone this way, but he seemed particularly dismissive of me. But I wonder if he had been more respectful if I wasn't Muslim.

feedback.title: Respect
feedback.text: I guess he was polite, but I definitely did not feel respected. He didn't acknowledge my religious beliefs.

feedback.title: Trustworthiness
feedback.text: Once I showed him my face, he did what he said he would do, and he didn't give me a ticket. But he was disrespectful, and it's things like this that make me lose trust in ALL law enforcement.

text.classNames: w-full h-full bg-black flex items-center justify-center
text.content:
And later that evening, over dinner,
the driver tells her husband about
what happened...
